1.text: Then Pilate took Jesus and had him flogged.

2.text: The soldiers twisted thorns into a crown, placed it on his head, and dressed him in a purple garment.

3.text: They kept saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!” and they kept slapping him.

4.text: Then Pilate went out again. He said to the Jews, “Behold, I bring him out to you, so that you may know that I find no basis for a charge against him.”

5.text: When Jesus came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple garment, Pilate said to them, “Behold, the man!”

6.text: But when the chief priests and the officers saw Jesus, they shouted, “Crucify! Crucify him!” Pilate answered, “Take him yourselves, and crucify him, for I find no basis for a charge against him.”

7.text: The Jews insisted, “We have a law, and according to our law, he should die, because he made himself the Son of God.”

8.text: However, when Pilate heard these words, he was even more afraid.

9.text: Returning into the Praetorium, he asked Jesus, “Where are you from?” But Jesus gave him no answer.

10.text: Then Pilate asked him, “Are you not speaking to me? Do you not know that I have the power to crucify you, and the power to release you?”

11.text: Jesus answered, “You would have no power at all against me, unless it were given to you from above. Therefore, he who delivered me to you has a greater sin.”

12.text: From then on, Pilate tried to release Jesus, but the Jews cried out, “If you release this man, you are not Caesar’s friend! Everyone who makes himself a king speaks against Caesar!”

13.text: When Pilate heard this word, he brought Jesus out and sat down on the judgment seat at a place called “The Pavement,” and in Hebrew, “Gabbatha.”

14.text: Now it was the Preparation Day of the Passover, at about the sixth hour. He said to the Jews, “Behold, your King!”

15.text: But they shouted, “Away with him! Away with him! Crucify him!” Pilate asked them, “Shall I crucify your King?” The chief priests answered, “We have no king but Caesar!”

16.text: And so, Pilate delivered Jesus to them to be crucified.  Then the guards took Jesus and led him away.

17.text: He went out, bearing his cross, to the place called “The Place of a Skull,” which is called in Hebrew, “Golgotha.”

18.text: There they crucified him, and along with him two other men, one on each side and Jesus in the middle.

19.text: Pilate also wrote a notice and had it placed on the cross. It read, “Jesus of Nazareth, the King of the Jews.”

20.text: Many of the Jews read this inscription because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city, and it was written in Hebrew, Greek, and Latin.

21.text: Then the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, “Do not write, ‘The King of the Jews,’ but, ‘he said, I am King of the Jews.’”

22.text: Pilate answered, “What I have written, I have written.”

23.text: After the soldiers had crucified Jesus, they took his garments and divided them into four parts, to every soldier a part; with the tunic remaining. Now the tunic was without seam, woven from the top throughout.

24.text: Then they said to one another, “Let us not tear it, but cast lots for it to decide whose it will be!” This was to fulfill the Scripture which says:  They have divided my garments among them and   for my cloak they cast lots.   And this is what the soldiers did.

25.text: But there were standing by the cross of Jesus his mother, and his mother’s sister (Mary [the wife] of Clopas), and Mary Magdalene.

26.text: When Jesus saw his mother and the disciple whom he loved standing there, he said to his mother, “Woman, behold your son!”

27.text: Then he said to the disciple, “Behold, your mother!” And from that hour, the disciple took her to his own home.

28.text: After this, perceiving that all things were now accomplished, and so that the Scripture might be fulfilled, Jesus said, “I am thirsty.”

29.text: Now a vessel full of sour wine had been placed there; so [the soldiers] filled a sponge with sour wine, put it on [a stick of] hyssop, and held it at his mouth.

30.text: Then, after Jesus received the sour wine, he said, “It is accomplished!” And he bowed his head and gave up his spirit.

31.text: Because it was the Day of Preparation, in order that the bodies would not remain on the cross on the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was a great day), the Jews asked Pilate that the legs [of those crucified] might be broken, and that they might be removed.

32.text: Therefore, the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first who had been crucified with Jesus, then the legs of the other.

33.text: But when they came to Jesus and saw that he was already dead, they did not break his legs.

34.text: However, one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear, and immediately, blood and water came out.

35.text: He who has seen [this] has borne witness, and his testimony is true. He knows that he tells the truth, so that you may believe.

36.text: For these things happened so that the Scripture might be fulfilled, “Not one of his bones will be broken.”

37.text: Again, another Scripture says, “They will look on him whom they pierced.”

38.text: And after these things, Joseph of Arimathaea (who was a disciple of Jesus but secretly for fear of the Jews) asked Pilate for permission to take away the body of Jesus. Pilate gave him permission, and so Joseph came and took away his body.

39.text: And Nicodemus (who earlier had come to Jesus by night) also came and brought a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred Roman pounds.

40.text: Then they took Jesus’ body and wrapped it in linen cloths with the spices, according to the burial custom of the Jews.

41.text: Now there was a garden at the place where Jesus had been crucified. In the garden, there was a new tomb in which no one had ever yet been laid.

42.text: Then, because it was the Jewish day of Preparation and since the tomb was nearby, they laid Jesus there.
